TEXT.English: [TAB]Hydroponics is the science of growing vegetables in nutrient solutions rather than in soil. The earliest references to hydroponics date back to the seventeenth century, and while notable advances in research were seen over the following centuries, the first practical applications of hydroponics did not appear until the early twentieth century, and mass adoption didn't occur until the middle of the twenty-first century. There are two primary benefits to growing plants in nutrient solutions rather than in soil: the nutrient solution can be sterilized (unlike soil), greatly reducing the occurrence of disease and pests in the plants, and a much greater number of crops can be grown in a small area. [PARAGRAPH:2]The primary downside to this method of cultivation is that it requires a fair degree of technical know-how to install and maintain the complicated machines necessary to keep the "scum-ponds" healthy and productive. However, once education levels improved in rural populations across the world, this was no longer an impediment, and the practice has since spread rapidly, greatly increasing the world's food supply.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les cultures hydroponiques consistent à faire pousser des légumes dans des solutions nutritives plutôt qu'en les plantant dans le sol. Les premières expériences menées dans ce sens datent du dix-septième siècle et les progrès dans ce domaine n'ont jamais ralenti depuis lors. La première application pratique des cultures hydroponiques a été introduite au début du vingtième siècle, mais leur développement à l'échelle industrielle ne fut véritablement au point qu'au milieu du vingt-et-unième siècle. Il y a deux avantages majeurs à faire pousser des plantes dans des solutions nutritives plutôt que dans la terre : la solution peut être stérilisée (contrairement à la terre), ce qui réduit considérablement les risques de maladies ainsi que l'usage des pesticides ; et la quantité de plantes produites est nettement plus importante pour une même surface.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le principal inconvénient de cette méthode est le fait qu'elle requiert un certain savoir-faire technologique pour être mise en place et qu'elle nécessite une machinerie très complexe afin de maintenir un bon niveau de productivité. Cependant, le niveau d'éducation s'est nettement amélioré dans les milieux ruraux et la pratique des cultures hydroponiques s'est très largement répandue, augmentant considérablement la production mondiale de nourriture.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Hydrokultur ist die Wissenschaft der Kultivierung von Pflanzen in Nährlösung statt in Erde. Die früheste Erwähnung dieser Form der Pflanzenzucht datiert auf das 17. Jahrhundert. In den darauf folgenden Jahrhunderten wurden bemerkenswerte Fortschritte erzielt, so dass im frühen 20. Jahrhundert erste praktische Anwendungen dokumentiert sind und ab Mitte des 21. Jahrhunderts eine verbreitete Nutzung einsetzte. Die Züchtung von Pflanzen in Nährlösung statt in Mutterboden hat vor allem zwei Vorteile: Die Nährlösung kann sterilisiert werden (im Gegensatz zum Mutterboden), wodurch sich das Risiko von Krankheiten und Schädlingsbefall deutlich reduziert. Und zum anderen lässt sich der Ernteertrag schon auf einer vergleichsweise kleinen Bebauungsfläche massiv steigern. [PARAGRAPH:2]Der größte Nachteil der Hydrokultur ist dagegen, dass ein gewisses Maß an technischem Wissen erforderlich ist, um die komplexen Gerätschaften zu installieren und zu steuern, die das "Feuchtbiotop" gesund und produktiv halten. Mit steigendem Bildungsniveau auch in der ländlichen Bevölkerung überall auf der Welt stellte dies jedoch schon bald kein nennenswertes Hindernis mehr dar und so fand diese Kultivierungsmethode seither sehr schnelle Verbreitung, wodurch sich die weltweite Nahrungsversorgung spürbar verbesserte.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'idroponica è la scienza che permette di crescere i vegetali in soluzioni nutrienti, invece che nel suolo. I primi riferimenti all'idroponica risalgono al diciassettesimo secolo e, mentre ci sono stati notevoli sviluppi nei secoli seguenti, le prime applicazioni pratiche dell'idroponica non sono apparse se non all'inizio del ventesimo secolo e l'uso diffuso non venne adottato fino alla metà del ventunesimo. Ci sono due benefici principali, nel crescere le piante in soluzioni nutrienti invece che nella terra: la soluzione nutriente può essere sterilizzata (a differenza del suolo), riducendo di molto malattie e parassiti delle piante, e può essere coltivata una quantità molto più grande su un'area ridotta. [PARAGRAPH:2]Lo svantaggio principale di questo metodo di coltivazione è che richiede un discreto grado di conoscenze tecniche, per installare e far funzionare i complicati macchinari necessari a mantenere le vasche sane e produttive. Dopo che i livelli di educazione della popolazione rurale mondiale sono saliti, però, questo non è stato più un problema e la pratica si è diffusa rapidamente, aumentando di molto la produzione di cibo mondial
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La hidroponía es la ciencia de cultivar vegetales en soluciones de nutrientes en vez de en la tierra. Las primeras referencias a la hidroponía datan del s. XVII y, aunque se experimentaron notables avances en los siguientes siglos, las primeras aplicaciones prácticas no tuvieron lugar hasta principios del s. XX y no se aplicó masivamente hasta mediados del XXI. Existen dos beneficios principales en el cultivo de plantas en soluciones de nutrientes en lugar de en tierra: las primeras pueden esterilizarse (al contrario que la segunda), lo que reduce enormemente los casos de enfermedades y plagas en las plantas y aumenta el número de cultivos que pueden plantarse en un área muy reducida. [PARAGRAPH:2]La principal contrapartida de este método de cultivo es que requiere un buen nivel de conocimientos técnicos para instalar y mantener las complicadas máquinas necesarias para conservar las "algas flotantes" productivas y en buen estado. Sin embargo, una vez mejorados los niveles educativos en las poblaciones rurales de todo el mundo, ya no hubo impedimento alguno, y dicha práctica se ha extendido rápidamente y ha incrementado enormemente los suministros alimenticios del mund

TEXT.English: [TAB]Humans have used biological warfare against each other for untold centuries. The earliest efforts were crude - throwing diseased corpses into cities under siege, giving the blankets of plague victims to unsuspecting natives, and so forth - but effective. Biological warfare was outlawed on Earth in the twentieth century, but that didn't stop a lot of countries and terrorist organizations from continuing to research and refine such weapons - "just in case." [PARAGRAPH:2]The biggest drawbacks to such weaponry remains the difficulty of delivering a large enough dose to be immediately effective, as well as figuring out a way to ensure that the disease doesn't turn around and wipe your side out as well as your enemy. While the first difficulty has been somewhat addressed with the creation of super viruses capable of surviving being dispersed from a missile warhead to cover a large area, the latter remains somewhat problematic: the new viruses are designed to be short-lived and to burn themselves out after a few days or weeks, but like all other viruses they are capable of mutation - perhaps into something far more persistent and easily spreadable - so the risks remain extremely high. Only the most foolish nation would use such a weapon except in the direst of needs.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les humains utilisent des armes biologiques depuis des siècles. Les premiers cas remontent au Moyen Age, lorsque les assaillants jetaient des cadavres en décomposition dans les villes assiégées pour y répandre des épidémies. La guerre biologique fut interdite sur Terre au vingtième siècle, mais cela n'empêcha pas un grand nombre de pays ou d'organisations terroristes de continuer à développer des armes biologiques "au cas où". [PARAGRAPH:2]Les deux plus grands inconvénients d'un tel arsenal sont, d'une part, la difficulté de répandre une dose assez importante pour être efficace et, d'autre part, le risque d'en subir soi-même les effets. Le premier problème a pu être contourné par la création de super virus embarqués à bord de missiles et dispersés au-dessus de larges territoires, mais le second reste insoluble. En effet, les nouveaux virus sont conçus pour ne vivre que quelques jours ou quelques semaines mais ils sont, comme tous les virus, sujets à des mutations qui peuvent les rendre plus résistants ou plus contagieux. Toute nation qui entreprendrait d'utiliser une telle arme prendrait le risque de provoquer la fin de l'humanité.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Schon seit unzähligen Jahrhunderten haben sich die Menschen die biologische Kriegsführung zunutze gemacht, um sich gegenseitig zu bekämpfen. Die ersten Angriffe dieser Art waren höchst barbarisch - so wurden beispielsweise verseuchte Leichen in belagerte Städte geworfen, Decken von Pestopfern an arglose Einheimische verteilt und so weiter - aber dennoch effizient. Im 20. Jahrhundert war die biologische Kriegsführung schließlich weltweit geächtet, trotzdem ließen sich viele Länder und terroristische Vereinigungen nicht davon abhalten, weiterhin entsprechende Waffen zu erforschen und zu entwickeln - "nur für den Fall". [PARAGRAPH:2]Die größte Schwierigkeit beim Einsatz dieser Art von Waffen ist, eine hinreichend große Dosis freizusetzen, damit der biologische Kampfstoff sofort wirkt, gleichzeitig aber auch sicherzustellen, dass er sich nur gegen den Feind, nicht aber gegen die eigenen Reihen richtet. Das erste Problem wurde zum Teil durch die Entwicklung von Superviren gelöst, die mittels eines Sprengkopfes freigesetzt werden und dann ein großes Areal befallen, die zweite Problematik bleibt aber nach wie vor bestehen: Die neuen Viren besitzen lediglich eine begrenzte Lebensdauer und verlieren nach ein paar Tagen oder Wochen ihre Wirkung, aber wie alle anderen Viren sind auch sie in der Lage zu mutieren - möglicherweise sogar eine deutlich höhere Widerstands- oder Ausbreitungsfähigkeit zu entwickeln - so dass das Risiko auch für die Reihen des Angreifers extrem hoch bleibt. Nur eine völlig irrsinnige Nation würde eine derartige Waffe in einem anderen als dem schlimmsten Fall einsetzen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Gli umani hanno usato la guerra biologica per innumerevoli secoli. I primi tentativi erano rozzi ma efficaci, come lanciare cadaveri di morti per malattia nelle città sotto assedio, dare le coperte di vittime di un'epidemia a nativi ignari, e così via. La guerra biologica fu bandita sulla Terra nel ventesimo secolo, ma ciò non impedì a molte nazioni e organizzazioni terroristiche di continuare la ricerca e affinare tali armi... "giusto in caso servissero." [PARAGRAPH:2]Lo svantaggio maggiore di tali armi è la difficoltà di usare una dose abbastanza grande da essere immediatamente efficace, così come di trovare un modo per assicurarsi che la malattia non si "rivolti contro" ed elimini completamente le tue truppe, oltre a quelle del nemico. Mentre il primo problema è stato in qualche modo risolto con la creazione di super-virus in grado di sopravvivere alla diffusione tramite missile, per coprire un'area molto grande, il secondo rimane scottante: i nuovi virus sono progettati per avere una vita molto breve e morire dopo pochi giorni o settimane, ma come tutti i virus sono in grado di mutare, magari in qualcosa di più persistente e di facile diffusione, quindi i rischi rimangono molto alti. Solo una nazione molto stupida userebbe una tale arma, se non nel bisogno più disperat
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los humanos han usado la guerra biológica unos contra otros durante innumerables siglos. Los primeros esfuerzos fueron muy rudimentarios pero efectivos: lanzamiento de cadáveres enfermos en ciudades asediadas, entrega de mantas de víctimas de la peste a los incautos nativos, etcétera. La guerra biológica estuvo prohibida en la Tierra durante el s. XX, cosa que no impidió que numerosos países y organizaciones terroristas siguieran investigando y perfeccionando este tipo de armas "por si acaso". [PARAGRAPH:2]El mayor inconveniente de dicho armamento reside en la dificultad de lanzar un ataque lo bastante grande para que sea inmediatamente efectivo, así como en encontrar la manera de asegurarse de que la enfermedad no cambie de dirección y elimine tanto a los enemigos como a los del propio bando. Mientras que la primera dificultad se ha subsanado en parte con la creación de supervirus capaces de sobrevivir tras ser dispersados con una cabeza de misil para cubrir una gran extensión, la segunda parece algo más problemática: los nuevos virus están diseñados para tener una corta vida y autodestruirse tras pocos días o semanas, pero, como todo virus, tienen la capacidad de mutar, tal vez en algo mucho más persistente y fácil de propagar, por lo que los riesgos son extremadamente altos. Solo la nación más imprudente usaría un arma como ésta, excepto en el caso de necesidad más desesperad

TEXT.English: [TAB]Providing shielding for the great domed city arcologies has proven quite challenging. Early attempts relied on thick walls of heavy material; however, bitter experience proved that this material was incapable of fully resisting modern missiles and other armaments - and when it failed, the falling shielding material was at least as dangerous as the missiles themselves to the people below.[PARAGRAPH:2]More recent attempts have relied on much thinner material whose molecular bonds are artificially strengthened by energy fields. The shield material and generators are expensive, but they have proven to provide some protection against nuclear and non-nuclear attack.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Equiper les grandes arcologies pourvues de dômes avec des boucliers n'a pas été une mince affaire. Les premières tentatives ont abouti sur la construction de murs épais construits dans des matériaux lourds et solides. Malheureusement, l'expérience a montré que ces murs n'étaient pas capables de résister aux missiles modernes et qu'ils constituaient, en cas d'attaque, un danger supplémentaire pour les populations situées en dessous. [PARAGRAPH:2]Des essais plus récents ont reposé sur l'utilisation de matériaux plus fins et plus légers, dont la composition moléculaire était renforcée artificiellement par des champs de force. Ces matériaux et les générateurs qu'ils nécessitent sont très coûteux, mais ils sont efficaces contre les missiles, même nucléaires.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Entwicklung eines Schildes für die großen, mit Kuppeln versehenen städtischen Arkologien hat sich als recht kompliziert erwiesen. Für die ersten entsprechenden Versuche wurden dicke Platten aus schwerem Material verwendet, doch dann musste man die bittere Erfahrung machen, dass sie modernen Raketen oder anderen Panzerwaffen nicht standhalten konnten. Darüber hinaus stellten sich die herabfallenden Schildtrümmer als mindestens genauso gefährlich für die darunter befindlichen Menschen heraus wie die Geschosse selbst.[PARAGRAPH:2]Bei den jüngeren Versuchen probierte man daher dünnere Materialien aus, deren molekulare Verbindung durch Energiefelder künstlich verstärkt wird. Dieses Schildmaterial und die zugehörigen Generatoren sind zwar recht teuer, dafür bieten sie aber immerhin einen gewissen Schutz gegen atomare wie auch nicht atomare Angriffe.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Fornire di scudi le grandi cupole delle arcologie è stato abbastanza difficile. I primi tentativi si basavano su spessi strati di materiale pesante. Amare esperienze hanno però dimostrato come questo materiale fosse incapace di resistere appieno ai moderni missili e altre armi e, quando cedeva, per la gente che si trovava sotto, gli scudi che cadevano erano pericolosi quanto gli stessi missili.[PARAGRAPH:2]I tentativi più recenti si affidano a un materiale molto più sottile, i cui legami molecolari sono rinforzati artificialmente mediante dei campi energetici. Il materiale degli scudi e i generatori sono costosi, ma hanno provato di fornire adeguata protezione contro attacchi nucleari e no
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Proteger las grandes ciudades abovedadas que son las arcologías ha demostrado ser todo un desafío. Los primeros ataques contra las gruesas murallas de duro material aportaron, sin embargo, la amarga experiencia de que era incapaz de aguantar los misiles modernos y demás armamento y, al caer, el material era como mínimo igual de peligroso que los mismos misiles para las personas que estaban debajo.[PARAGRAPH:2]Iniciativas más recientes se han basado en materiales más delgados cuyas cadenas moleculares están fortalecidas artificialmente mediante campos de energía. El material protector y los generadores son caros, pero han demostrado ser eficaces contra los ataques, nucleares o n

TEXT.English: [TAB]While the first animals were successfully cloned in the late twentieth century, human cloning was not perfected until decades later. And then only if one uses the term "perfected" in the loosest sense. After much research it became possible to create a physical clone of a human being, identical to the original model down to the smallest detail; however, the clones remain frustratingly incapable of rational thought. All attempts to educate these creatures have failed miserably, and the "smartest" clone remains little more than a drooling moron whose needs must be constantly attended to. So while clones remain excellent organ and limb donors, up until recently little else could be done with them. [PARAGRAPH:2]Recent scientific advances have allowed clones to be equipped with sophisticated computer systems capable of controlling the clones' movement. While the computers are not yet sophisticated enough to allow for the creation of "clone warriors," the zombie-like beings are capable of performing simple, repetitive actions like building roads, tilling farmland, and so forth, doing so more efficiently than purely human workers.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les premiers clonages d'animaux datent de la fin du vingtième siècle, mais le clonage humain ne fut mis au point que plusieurs dizaines d'années plus tard. Et même alors, tout n'était pas encore parfait. Après des longues recherches, il fut enfin possible de créer le clone physique d'un être humain, identique en tous points à son modèle. Cependant, ces clones étaient dénués de toute forme d'intelligence. Toutes les tentatives pour éduquer ces créatures échouèrent lamentablement et même les clones les plus évolués s'avérèrent incapables de survivre de manière autonome. Ils furent donc exclusivement utilisés comme donneurs d'organes. [PARAGRAPH:2]Des progrès récents ont permis d'équiper les clones de programmes informatiques très complexes, capables d'en contrôler les mouvements. Si cette technologie ne permet pas à l'heure actuelle la création de "guerriers clones", elle permet de les transformer en automates et de leur assigner des tâches simples et répétitives, comme la construction des routes ou le labourage des terres. Force est de constater que leur efficacité dans ces domaines est nettement supérieure à celle des humains.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Bereits im späten 20. Jahrhundert wurden erstmals Tiere erfolgreich geklont, doch das Klonen des Menschen wurde erst Jahrzehnte später perfektioniert - wobei der Begriff "perfektioniert" hier lediglich im einfachsten Sinne gemeint ist. Nach intensiver Forschungsarbeit war es möglich geworden, einen Klon von einem menschlichen Wesen zu erschaffen, der physisch bis ins kleinste Detail mit dem Original übereinstimmte, allerdings nicht in der Lage war, rational zu denken. Alle Versuche, diese Kreaturen zu erziehen bzw. auszubilden, scheiterten kläglich und so war selbst der "klügste" Klon kaum mehr als ein geifernder Volltrottel, der ständiger Betreuung bedurfte. Dementsprechend stellten Klone zwar hervorragende Organ- und Gliedmaßenspender dar, ansonsten konnte man aber nicht allzu viel mit ihnen anfangen - doch dies änderte sich vor kurzem. [PARAGRAPH:2]Dank jüngster wissenschaftlicher Erkenntnisse können Klone nun mit ausgefeilten Computersystemen ausgestattet werden, welche die Steuerung ihrer Bewegungen ermöglichen. Die Computer sind zurzeit zwar noch nicht so gut entwickelt, dass sie die Erschaffung von "Klonkriegern" ermöglichen würden, dennoch können Klone jetzt wie Golems einfache, sich wiederholende Tätigkeiten ausführen und dadurch zum Beispiel im Straßenbau, für die Feldarbeit usw. eingesetzt werden - das sogar effizienter als menschliche Arbeiter.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Mentre i primi animali furono clonati con successo nel tardo ventesimo secolo, la clonazione umana non venne perfezionata se non decenni più tardi. E solo se usiamo il termine "perfezionata" nel senso meno stretto. Dopo molte ricerche divenne possibile creare un clone fisico di un essere umano, identico al modello originale fino al più piccolo dettaglio. I cloni rimangono però incapaci di pensare. Tutti i tentativi di educare queste creature sono miseramente falliti e anche il più "intelligente" clone rimane un idiota bavoso che deve essere costantemente accudito. E così, pur essendo i cloni eccellenti donatori di parti e organi, fino a poco tempo fa è stato possibile usarli per ben poco altro. [PARAGRAPH:2]Recenti scoperte scientifiche hanno permesso ai cloni di essere equipaggiati con sofisticati computer in grado di controllare i loro movimenti. Pur non essendo i computer abbastanza sofisticati da poter creare dei "guerrieri cloni", questi esseri tipo zombi sono in grado di compiere azioni semplici e ripetitive come costruire strade, lavorare la terra e via dicendo, facendolo in maniera più efficiente dei lavoratori uman
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Mientras que a finales del s. XX ya se clonaban animales con éxito, la clonación humana no se perfeccionó hasta décadas después. Y solo si se usa el término "perfeccionar" en el más laxo de los sentidos. Tras largas investigaciones fue posible crear un clon físico de un ser humano, idéntico al modelo original hasta en el más mínimo detalle. Sin embargo, los clones siguen siendo frustrantemente incapaces de tener cualquier pensamiento racional. Todos los intentos de educar a dichas criaturas han fracasado miserablemente y el clon "más listo" es algo más que un tonto babeante que requiere atención continua. Así que, aunque los clones son excelentes donantes de órganos y miembros, poco más se puede hacer con ellos. [PARAGRAPH:2]Los últimos avances científicos han permitido que los clones se equipen con sofisticados equipos informáticos capaces de controlar sus movimientos. Aunque los ordenadores no son todavía lo bastante sofisticados como para permitir la creación de "guerreros clonados", los cuasi zombis son capaces de realizar acciones simples y repetitivas, como construir carreteras, labrar la tierra y, además, hacerlo mejor que los trabajadores completamente humano

TEXT.English: [TAB]Aquaculture is the practice of cultivating the produce of water for consumption. Humans have been harvesting the bounty of the seas for all of history; however, as human population has grown exponentially, by the late twentieth century, much greater emphasis has been placed on so-called "sustainable" aquaculture. Indeed the Treaty of Iceland, signed in 2033, mandated that, "No fish or mammal may be harvested from the ocean unless an equal or greater number of the same species are released into the wild at the same time." Unfortunately, with the collapse of the One World Government this treaty lost much of its efficacy, and the world's once-boundless supply of food is again under grave and imminent peril. [PARAGRAPH:2]Facing this dwindling supply of animal protein, aquaculture has focused upon the cultivation of oceanic vegetation like kelp and seaweed. Although plentiful, the resulting food has met with mixed reviews: while certain island and coastal cultures claim that these foods are delicacies, the rest of humanity appears to be in general agreement that they taste "like salty rubber, but not as good."
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'aquaculture est le terme générique qui sert à désigner toutes les activités de production animales ou végétales en milieu aquatique. Tout au long de leur histoire, les humains ont exploité les richesses de la mer. Mais avec la croissance exponentielle de la population humaine, la fin du vingtième siècle a vu apparaître les besoins d'une aquaculture viable. Ainsi, le Traité d'Islande, ratifié en 2033, stipulait : "Aucun poisson ou mammifère ne peut être extrait des mers ou des océans, à moins qu'une quantité équivalente de la même espèce ne soit rendue à la vie sauvage dans le même temps." Malheureusement, depuis la chute du Gouvernement Mondial, le traité est tombé en désuétude et la faune marine est à nouveau menacée d'extinction.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pour faire face à la pénurie de protéines animales, l'aquaculture s'est concentrée sur l'exploitation de cultures végétales océaniques comme le varech et les algues. Bien que très abondante, cette nourriture rencontre un succès mitigé : certaines populations côtières se réjouissent de cette révolution alimentaire mais le reste de l'humanité semble s'accorder à penser que "ça a un goût de caoutchouc salé, en moins bon".
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Aquakultur beschreibt eine Methode zur Kultivierung von Meeresfrüchten und Fisch als Nahrungsmittel. Zwar wurden die Früchte des Meeres von jeher von den Menschen geerntet, als die Weltbevölkerung im späten 20. Jahrhundert jedoch sprunghaft anstieg, war man gezwungen, sich auch der so genannten "erneuerbaren" Aquakultur zuzuwenden. Im Wesentlichen wurde im Rahmen des Abkommens von Island aus dem Jahr 2033 beschlossen, dass "kein Fisch oder Säugetier dem Meer entnommen werden darf, wenn nicht gleichzeitig dieselbe oder eine höhere Anzahl derselben Spezies in die Wildnis entlassen wird". Unglücklicherweise wurde dieses Abkommen nach dem Zerfall der Weltregierung weitgehend von den Nationen ignoriert, so dass die einst grenzenlosen Nahrungsvorräte der Erde mittlerweile abermals extrem und unmittelbar gefährdet sind. [PARAGRAPH:2]Angesichts des schwindenden Nachschubs an tierischen Proteinen konzentriert sich die Aquakultur nun auf die Kultivierung ozeanischer Vegetation wie Seetang und Algen. Dadurch ist die Nahrungsversorgung zwar wieder gesichert, diese Art Lebensmittel an sich wird jedoch durchaus unterschiedlich bewertet: Während bestimmte Insel- und Küstenkulturen die so gewonnene Nahrung als Delikatesse betrachten, scheint der Rest der Menschheit allgemein darin übereinzustimmen, dass sie "wie salziges Gummi, nur noch schlechter" schmeckt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'acquicoltura è la pratica di coltivare i prodotti acquatici per consumarli. Per tutta la loro storia gli uomini hanno raccolto i frutti dei mari ma, con la crescita esponenziale della popolazione, nel tardo ventesimo secolo è stata posta grande enfasi sulla cosiddetta acquicoltura "sostenibile". Il trattato d'Islanda, firmato nel 2033, afferma che "Non è permesso pescare pesci o mammiferi a meno che non ne venga rilasciato allo stesso tempo un numero pari o superiore." Sfortunatamente con il crollo del governo mondiale il trattato ha perso gran parte della propria efficacia e la riserva una volta infinita di cibo è ancora una volta in imminente e grave pericolo. [PARAGRAPH:2]Di fronte alla sempre più scarsa disponibilità di proteine animali, l'acquicoltura si è concentrata sulla coltivazione di vegetazione oceanica, come le alghe. Anche se abbondante, il cibo che ne deriva ha provocato reazioni diverse: mentre certe culture isolane e costiere affermano che si tratta di prelibatezze, il resto dell'umanità appare essere d'accordo sul fatto che "sa di gomma salata, ma non è così buono."
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La acuicultura es la práctica de cultivar los frutos del agua para su consumo. Los humanos han estado cosechando el botín del mar durante toda su historia. Sin embargo, a medida que la población humana fue creciendo exponencialmente, se fue poniendo desde finales del s. XX mucho énfasis en la llamada acuicultura "sostenible". Además, el tratado de Islandia, firmado en 2033, ordenó que: "No se podrán cazar peces ni mamíferos del océano si no se libera la misma o mayor cantidad de especímenes al mismo tiempo". Por desgracia, con la caída del Gobierno Único Mundial, dicho tratado perdió gran parte de su eficacia y el infinito suministro de alimentos mundial vuelve a estar en un peligro grave e inminente. [PARAGRAPH:2]Para paliar la falta de proteínas animales, la acuicultura se ha centrado en el cultivo de vegetales marinos como laminarias y algas marinas. Aunque abundante, el alimento resultante ha recibido opiniones encontradas: mientras ciertas culturas isleñas y costeras afirman que dichos alimentos son exquisiteces, el resto de la humanidad parece estar de acuerdo en que "saben como goma salada, o incluso peor"

TEXT.English: [TAB]Bionics is the science of applying systems and methods found in nature to technology. This has been done throughout human history of course - basing the shape of an aircraft's wing on that of a bird's wing is one classic example. As the twenty-first century has progressed, great strides have been made in using the model of a living brain to create highly intelligent, adaptable super-computers. [PARAGRAPH:2]While the potential for such machines to aid human growth and development is virtually unlimited, most of the existing "organic computers" have been requisitioned by national militaries, where they are implanted in clones and spend their existence trying to blow each other up. The so-called "automaton" soldiers are less intelligent than their human counterparts - the human brain remains far more sophisticated than any man-made artifact of the same weight and size - but on the other hand the automatons are totally without fear and they follow orders without question. Most human generals think they're totally cool.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La bionique est une science qui étudie les phénomènes naturels susceptibles d'avoir des applications technologiques. Il s'agit d'une science aussi vieille que l'homme. Les ailes des avions, reprenant l'exemple des oiseaux, en sont un exemple classique. Ainsi, dès le vingt-et-unième siècle, l'observation du cerveau humain a permis la mise au point d'ordinateurs organiques très intelligents. [PARAGRAPH:2]Le potentiel de ces machines est quasiment illimité lorsqu'il s'agit d'aider à la croissance et au développement des activités humaines, cependant, la plupart des ordinateurs organiques existants ont été réquisitionnés par les armées, qui les ont greffés sur des clones programmés pour se battre. Ces soldats "automates" sont moins intelligents que les humains (le cerveau humain reste bien plus complexe que les cerveaux artificiels les plus sophistiqués) mais ils ignorent la peur et obéissent aveuglément aux ordres. La plupart des généraux humains applaudissent cette révolution des deux mains.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Bionik ist die Wissenschaft der Umsetzung natürlicher Systeme und Verfahren in der Technik. Dies wurde im Grunde schon in der gesamten Menschheitsgeschichte in den verschiedensten Bereichen versucht - ein klassisches Beispiel hierfür ist die Konstruktion von Flugzeugtragflächen, die sich an der Flügelform der Vögel orientierten. Im Laufe des 21. Jahrhunderts erzielte man mit der Entwicklung hochintelligenter, lernfähiger Supercomputer nach dem Vorbild des menschlichen Gehirns schließlich erhebliche Fortschritte auf diesem Gebiet. [PARAGRAPH:2]Obwohl das Potenzial dieser Maschinen für die Förderung des Wachstums und der Weiterentwicklung der Menschheit praktisch unbegrenzt ist, werden die "organischen Computer" in erster Linie von den nationalen Militärorganen mit Beschlag belegt, die sie in Klone implantieren und ihr Dasein lediglich darauf reduzieren, sich möglichst effizient gegenseitig in die Luft zu jagen. Die so genannten "Robotersoldaten" sind deutlich weniger intelligent als ihre menschlichen Kameraden - das menschliche Gehirn bleibt im Vergleich zu jeder von Menschenhand gefertigten Maschine gleichen Gewichts und gleicher Größe nach wie vor unübertroffen -, allerdings kennen die Roboter überhaupt keine Furcht und führen Befehle aus, ohne sie in Frage zu stellen. Und genau deshalb sind die meisten menschlichen Militärgeneräle auch so überaus begeistert von ihnen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La bionica è la scienza di applicare alla tecnologia sistemi e metodi che si trovano in natura. È sempre stato fatto, nella storia umana: basare la forma dell'ala di un aereo su quella di un uccello è un esempio classico. Con l'avanzamento del ventunesimo secolo, sono stati fatti grandi passi avanti nell'utilizzo del modello di un cervello vivo per la creazione di super computer molto intelligenti e adattabili. [PARAGRAPH:2]Il potenziale di queste macchine per aiutare la crescita e lo sviluppo umani è virtualmente illimitato, ma la maggior parte degli esistenti "computer organici" è stata requisita dagli eserciti nazionali ed è stata innestata in cloni che passano la loro esistenza a cercare di farsi saltare per aria. I cosiddetti soldati "automi" sono meno intelligenti delle loro controparti umane: il cervello umano rimane molto più sofisticato di qualsiasi manufatto dello stesso peso e con le stesse dimensioni. Ma c'è da considerare che gli automi sono completamente senza paura e seguono gli ordini senza esitare. La maggior parte dei generali umani li ador
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La biónica es la ciencia que aplica sistemas y métodos propios de la naturaleza a la tecnología. Por supuesto, se ha ido desarrollando a lo largo de la historia de la humanidad. Un ejemplo clásico es basar el diseño de un ala de avión en la de un pájaro. A medida que ha avanzado el s. XXI, se han hecho grandes progresos en la creación de superordenadores muy inteligentes y adaptables que copian el cerebro humano. [PARAGRAPH:2]A medida que el potencial de dichas máquinas para ayudar al ser humano ha crecido y su desarrollo prácticamente no conoce límites, la mayoría de los "ordenadores orgánicos" han sido requisados por los ejércitos nacionales, que los utilizan para implantarlos en clones y para intentar volarse unos a otros. Los llamados soldados "autómatas" son menos inteligentes que sus homólogos humanos: el cerebro humano sigue siendo más sofisticado que cualquier artefacto fabricado del mismo tamaño y peso. Sin embargo, los autómatas no conocen el miedo y siguen las órdenes sin cuestionarlas. La mayoría de los generales humanos piensan que son lo más de lo má

TEXT.English: [TAB]Cold fusion - a controllable fusion reaction occurring at or near room temperature - has long been the "holy grail" of modern physics. In 1989 two scientists claimed to have created a cold fusion reaction, but their claims were disputed by other scientist who could not duplicate their results. And even when the first verifiable cold fusion reaction was documented many decades later, the size of the reactor necessary and the small amount of power it generated made cold fusion totally inefficient for common use. It would be years before a practical cold fusion generator would be created. [PARAGRAPH:2]Once created, the cold fusion generator had the capacity to change human existence, creating cheap, near-pollution-free energy for all. Unfortunately, however, like so many other potentially beneficial technologies recently discovered, cold fusion technology has been appropriated and classified by the military, used almost exclusively to create power plants for ever larger and more destructive weapons platforms. In the meantime humanity has had to continue to survive on ever-dwindling and highly-polluting energy sources like coal, oil, and uranium.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La fusion froide est une réaction de fusion nucléaire réalisée dans des conditions de température et de pression ambiantes. Ce procédé fut longtemps le Saint Graal de la physique moderne. En 1989, deux scientifiques affirmèrent avoir cré une réaction de fusion froide, mais la commission chargée de valider leur découverte ne parvint pas à reproduire l'expérience. Lors de la première expérience attestée de fusion froide, quelques dizaines d'années plus tard, la taille du réacteur nécessaire pour produire une toute petite quantité d'énergie ne pouvait permettre d'en répandre l'usage. Ce n'est que bien des années plus tard que le générateur de fusion froide que nous connaissons aujourd'hui fut mis au point. [PARAGRAPH:2]Le générateur de fusion froide pouvait véritablement révolutionner le quotidien des populations. Grâce à lui, chacun pouvait bénéficier d'une source d'énergie bon marché et non polluante. Malheureusement, cette technologie fut, comme beaucoup d'autres, trustée par les militaires qui l'utilisèrent pour alimenter les chaînes de production d'armes extrêmement destructrices. Et pendant ce temps, l'humanité dut se contenter de survivre en utilisant des ressources de plus en rares et polluantes telles que le charbon, le pétrole et l'uranium.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Kaltfusion - eine kontrollierbare Fusionsreaktion, die in etwa bei Raumtemperatur stattfindet - wurde lange als der "Heilige Gral" der modernen Physik betrachtet. Im Jahr 1989 gaben zwei Wissenschaftler vor, eine Kaltfusionsreaktion erzeugt zu haben, allerdings wurden ihre Behauptungen von anderen Wissenschaftlern, welche die angeblich erzielten Ergebnisse nicht rekonstruieren konnten, widerlegt. Die erste nachweisbare Kaltfusionsreaktion wurde viele Jahrzehnte später dokumentiert, erwies sich aber wegen der enormen Dimensionen des benötigten Reaktors und der geringen erzeugten Energiemenge als unbrauchbar. Ein wirklich praktisch einsetzbarer Kaltfusionsgenerator wurde erst Jahre später gebaut. [PARAGRAPH:2]Die Kapazitäten dieses neuen Kaltfusionsgenerators wären durchaus geeignet, um die Lebensumstände der Menschen grundlegend zu verändern, denn er erzeugt nicht nur preiswerte, sondern auch nahezu schadstofffreie Energie zur allgemeinen Verwendung. Leider wird die Kaltfusionstechnologie jedoch wie so viele andere fortschrittliche Technologien der jüngeren Vergangenheit größtenteils von militärischen Organen vereinnahmt und somit fast ausschließlich zur Speisung von Kraftwerken verwendet, welche die Produktion noch größerer und vernichtenderer Waffen ermöglichen. Aus diesem Grund bleibt den Menschen nichts anderes übrig, als ihr Überleben auch weiterhin durch zusehends knapper werdende und höchst umweltschädliche Energiequellen wie Kohle, Öl und Uran zu sichern.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La fusione a freddo: una fusione controllabile che avviene a una temperatura quasi uguale a quella ambientale. È da molto il sacro graal della fisica moderna. Nel 1989 due scienziati affermarono di aver creato una reazione di fusione a freddo, ma le loro dichiarazioni furono confutate da altri scienziati che non riuscirono a riprodurre l'esperimento. Anche quando venne documentata la prima fusione a freddo verificabile, molti decenni dopo, le dimensioni del reattore necessario e la scarsa quantità di energia creata resero la fusione a freddo totalmente inefficace per l'uso comune. Sarebbero passati anni prima della creazione del primo reattore per la fusione a freddo pratico. [PARAGRAPH:2]Una volta creato, il reattore per la fusione a freddo riuscì a cambiare l'esistenza umana, creando energia gratuita e quasi totalmente non inquinante per tutti. Sfortunatamente, però, come tante altre tecnologie potenzialmente benefiche scoperte di recente, la tecnologia per la fusione a freddo è stata confiscata e classificata top secret dai militari, che la usano quasi esclusivamente per creare fonti di energia per armi sempre più devastanti. Nel frattempo l'umanità ha dovuto continuare a sopravvivere utilizzando fonti di energia inquinanti e in esaurimento come carbone, petrolio e uranio.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La fusión fría, una reacción de fusión controlada que tiene lugar más o menos a temperatura ambiente, ha sido el Santo Grial de la física moderna durante mucho tiempo. En 1989, dos científicos dijeron que habían creado la reacción de fusión fría, pero este honor se lo disputó otro científico, que fue incapaz de repetir sus resultados. E incluso cuando, muchas décadas más tarde, se documentó la primera reacción de fusión fría, el tamaño del reactor necesario y la escasa cantidad de energía que generaba hizo de ella algo completamente ineficaz para usos comunes. Tendrían que pasar años antes de que se creara el primer generador de fusión fría realmente práctico. [PARAGRAPH:2]Una vez creado, el generador tuvo la capacidad de cambiar la vida de las personas, pues creaba energía barata y limpia para todos. Por desgracia, como ocurre con la mayoría de las tecnologías potencialmente beneficiosas descubiertas recientemente, los militares se han apropiado de ella, la han declarado materia confidencial y la usan casi exclusivamente para crear plantas de energía para plataformas armamentísticas cada vez más grandes y destructivas. Mientras tanto, la humanidad para sobrevivir ha tenido que recurrir a fuentes de energía contaminantes y cada vez más escasas, como el carbón, el petróleo y el uranio.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Cybernetics is the study of communication and control in complex systems - human, animal, insect, or machine. (The word "cybernetics" is taken from a Greek word that means "the art of steering.") The fields of study within this broad subject run from examinations of how social structures - beehives, cities - react to, store, and pass on information, to how humans can best interface with the ever-more-important machines that increasingly affect our world. [PARAGRAPH:2]In the early twenty-first century, cybernetics became increasingly interested in human prosthetics, creating ever-more functional and useful replacements for lost limbs and organs. The most exciting breakthrough came when a team in Switzerland successfully transplanted a human brain into a fully-functional humanoid robot, creating the first true "cyborg" in history. And while the experiment was not a total success - the cyborg unfortunately went insane and killed the entire research team within moments after being awakened - the speed, skill and dexterity with which the cyborg dispatched the engineers were indeed quite impressive. Further experiments with cyborgs have since been limited to human clones, which are far less prone to psychosis.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La cybernétique est l'étude des échanges d'information et des moyens de les contrôler plus efficacement, que ce soit au niveau de l'homme, de l'animal ou de la machine. (Le mot "cybernétique" a pour sens étymologique "gouvernail".) Les champs d'étude de cette science vont de l'analyse de la gestion des informations par les structures sociales (ruches, villes, etc.) à celle de l'interaction entre les humains et les machines, qui prennent une place de plus en plus importante dans notre monde. [PARAGRAPH:2]Au début du vingt-et-unième siècle, la cybernétique commença à s'intéresser à la science des prothèses, pour permettre de remplacer efficacement les membres ou les organes endommagés. Cette technologie prit une nouvelle dimension lorsqu'une équipe suisse parvint à transplanter un cerveau humain sur un robot humanoïde, créant ainsi le premier cyborg de l'histoire. Cette expérience ne fut pas un succès complet (le cyborg devint incontrôlable et tua tous les membres de l'équipe de recherche peu de temps après avoir été animé) mais la rapidité, l'adresse et la dextérité dont fit preuve le cyborg pour massacrer les ingénieurs laissait entrevoir tout son potentiel. D'autres expériences ont depuis été menées sur des clones humains, bien moins susceptibles de céder à la psychose.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Kybernetik ist die Lehre der Kommunikation und Kontrolle in komplexen Systemen - Menschen, Tiere, Insekten und auch Maschinen betreffend. (Das Wort "Kybernetik" ist von dem griechischen Wort für "Steuermannskunst" abgeleitet.) Die Forschungen auf diesem weitläufigen Gebiet reichen von Untersuchungen hinsichtlich der Reaktion, Speicherung und Weitergabe von Informationen in sozialen Strukturen - zum Beispiel in Bienenstöcken oder Kommunen - bis hin zur Ergründung der bestmöglichen Interaktion zwischen den Menschen und den in der Welt immer mehr an Bedeutung gewinnenden Maschinen. [PARAGRAPH:2]Im frühen 21. Jahrhundert richtete sich das Interesse der Kybernetik-Wissenschaft verstärkt auf die menschliche Prothetik, welche die Herstellung funktionalerer Prothesen als Ersatz für verlorene Gliedmaßen und Organe ermöglicht. Der Aufsehen erregendste Durchbruch auf diesem Gebiet gelang einem Forschungsteam aus der Schweiz, das ein menschliches Gehirn in einen vollfunktionalen Roboter transplantierte und so den ersten echten "Cyborg" der Geschichte erschuf. Leider war dieses Experiment am Ende nicht wirklich von Erfolg gekrönt, denn der Cyborg geriet außer Kontrolle und tötete nur wenige Augenblicke nach seiner Aktivierung das gesamte Team - dennoch zeigte sich die Welt der Wissenschaft durchaus davon beeindruckt, wie schnell und geschickt der Cyborg bei der Tötung der Ingenieure vorgegangen war. Weitere Experimente mit Cyborgs beschränken sich seither allerdings sicherheitshalber auf menschliche Klone, die weitaus weniger anfällig für Psychosen sind.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La cibernetica è lo studio della comunicazione e del controllo nei sistemi complessi: umano, animale, insetto o macchina. ("Cibernetica" deriva da una parola greca che significa "arte di guidare.") I campi di studio di questo soggetto vanno dall'esame di come le strutture sociali (alveari, città) reagiscono, immagazzinano e trasmettono informazioni a come gli umani si possono interfacciare con le sempre più importanti macchine che influenzano sempre più il nostro mondo. [PARAGRAPH:2]All'inizio del ventunesimo secolo la cibernetica si interessò sempre più delle protesi umane, creando rimpiazzi sempre più funzionali e utili per sostituire parti e organi perduti. La scoperta più esaltante fu quando un team svizzero trapiantò un cervello umano in un robot umanoide completamente funzionante, creando il primo vero "cyborg" della storia. E pur se l'esperimento non fu un successo totale, visto che il cyborg impazzì e uccise l'intera squadra di ricerca pochi momenti dopo essere stato risvegliato, la velocità, l'abilità e l'agilità con cui il cyborg si occupò degli ingegneri erano davvero impressionanti. Ulteriori esperimenti con i cyborg da allora sono stati limitati ai cloni umani, che sono molto meno portati alla psicos
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La cibernética es el estudio de la comunicación y el control en sistemas complejos: humanos, animales, insectos o máquinas. El término "cibernética" está tomado del griego y significa "el arte de dirigir". Cubre un gran abanico de posibilidades. Su estudio va desde cómo las estructuras sociales (colmenas, ciudades) reaccionan, almacenan y transmiten información hasta cómo los humanos pueden mejorar su comunicación interfásica con esas máquinas que cada vez son más importantes y más afectan a nuestro mundo. [PARAGRAPH:2]A principios del s. XXI, la cibernética se fue interesando cada vez más en la protética humana, creando prótesis cada vez más útiles y funcionales para órganos y partes del cuerpo perdidas. El adelanto más impresionante tuvo lugar cuando un equipo suizo transplantó con éxito un cerebro humano en un robot humanoide completamente funcional, creando el primer "ciborg" auténtico de la historia. Aunque no se puede calificar a este experimento de éxito total (el ciborg se volvió loco y mató a todo el equipo de investigación instantes después de despertar), la velocidad, habilidad y destreza con las que el ciborg se deshizo de los ingenieros fueron del todo impresionantes. Los experimentos posteriores con ciborgs desde entonces se han limitado a los clones humanos, que son bastante menos propensos a la psicosi

TEXT.English: [TAB]In recent years great strides have been made in improving arcology shielding. The newer shields are far stronger than the originals; unfortunately they are also extremely expensive. They have a significant environmental impact, as well: the shields emit an extremely annoying high-pitched whining sound. Studies have shown that prolonged exposure to this sound causes heightened anxiety in humans, and, if continued indefinitely, leads to increased hostility, anger, and eventually to insanity.[PARAGRAPH:2]Significant efforts are being made to remove or at least reduce this sound. In the meantime, most cities leave these shields turned off until the city is under imminent threat; when the shields are turned on the cities attempt to mask the whining sound by playing loud, incessant "muzak" through huge speakers atop every building in the dome.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Au cours des dernières années, les boucliers d'arcologie ont été très nettement améliorés. Ces nouveaux boucliers sont plus résistants, mais aussi beaucoup plus chers. Autre inconvénient : leur impact sur l'environnement. Les boucliers émettent en permanence des sifflements stridents. Des études ont démontré qu'une exposition prolongée à ces sifflements accroît le stress et peut conduire à un sentiment de colère, d'agressivité, pouvant mener à la folie. [PARAGRAPH:2]Des efforts ont été faits pour supprimer, ou du moins réduire, ces sifflements. Toutefois, la plupart des villes ont opté pour une solution plus radicale : les boucliers sont désactivés tant qu'aucune menace n'est détectée et lorsqu'ils sont remis en service, les villes tentent de masquer les sifflements en diffusant une musique de fond dans les haut-parleurs des dômes.
TEXT.German: [TAB]In den letzten Jahren erzielte man große Fortschritte bei der Verbesserung von Arkologieschilden. Die neueren Modelle sind weitaus robuster als ihre Vorläufer, aber leider auch extrem teuer. Außerdem haben sie gravierende Auswirkungen auf die Umwelt, denn die Schilde sondern einen extrem hohen Heulton ab. Wissenschaftliche Untersuchungen haben gezeigt, dass Menschen, die diesem Ton längere Zeit ausgesetzt sind, unter stärkeren Angstzuständen leiden und, wenn er ununterbrochen zu hören ist, aggressiv, gewalttätig und schließlich sogar wahnsinnig werden.[PARAGRAPH:2]Um hier Abhilfe zu schaffen, wird gegenwärtig intensiv nach einer Methode geforscht, mit der diese Geräuschkulisse beseitigt oder zumindest gedämpft werden kann. Bis dahin lassen die meisten Städte ihre Schilde ausgeschaltet, sofern sie keiner konkreten, unmittelbaren Bedrohung ausgesetzt sind. Und wenn sie doch eingeschaltet werden müssen, versucht man, den Heulton durch unaufhörliches Abspielen sehr lauter Fahrstuhlmusik zu überdecken, die mittels riesiger Lautsprecher auf jedem Gebäude innerhalb der Kuppel ausgegeben wird.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Negli anni recenti sono stati fatti grossi passi avanti nel migliorare gli scudi dell'arcologia. I più recenti scudi sono molto più forti di quelli originali ma, sfortunatamente, sono anche estremamente costosi. Hanno anche un importante impatto ambientale: emettono un suono acuto e lamentoso estremamente irritante. Gli studi hanno dimostrato che una prolungata esposizione a questo suono causa negli umani un'elevata ansietà e, se continuato, porta a un'accresciuta ostilità, rabbia e infine alla pazzia.[PARAGRAPH:2]Si stanno facendo grandi sforzi per eliminare o almeno ridurre questo suono. Nel frattempo, la maggior parte delle città ha disattivato gli scudi fino a quando non saranno in immediato pericolo. Quando vengono attivati gli scudi, le città cercano di mascherarne il suono riproducendo incessantemente musica di sottofondo ad alto volume, attraverso enormi altoparlanti posti in cima a ogni edificio nella cupol
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]En los últimos años se han producido grandes avances en los escudos arcológicos. Los últimos son mucho más resistentes que los primeros, pero, desgraciadamente, también son muy caros. Además, tienen un impacto ambiental muy significativo: los escudos emiten un chirrido agudo de lo más insoportable. Los estudios demuestran que una exposición prolongada a este sonido aumenta la ansiedad en los humanos y, si es de forma indefinida, puede llevar a un aumento de la hostilidad, la ira y finalmente a la locura.[PARAGRAPH:2]Se están llevando a cabo importantes esfuerzos para eliminar o, al menos, reducir este sonido. Mientras tanto, la mayoría de las ciudades mantienen los escudos apagados hasta que la ciudad se encuentra en un peligro inminente. Cuando se encienden los escudos, las ciudades tratan de tapar el chirrido haciendo sonar el hilo musical al máximo volumen mediante los enormes altavoces que hay en lo alto de cada edificio de la bóved

TEXT.English: [TAB]Naval artillery in the Age of Sail encompasses the period of roughly 1571-1863: when large, sail-powered wooden naval warships dominated the high seas, mounting a bewildering variety of different types and sizes of cannon as their main armament. By modern standards, these cannon were extremely inefficient, difficult to load, and short ranged. These characteristics, along with the handling and seamanship of the ships that mounted them, defined the environment in which the Naval tactics in the Age of Sail developed. [PARAGRAPH:2]Firing a naval cannon required a great amount of labour and manpower. Cannon used gunpowder as the propellant, whose bulk had to be kept in a special storage area below deck for safety. A typical broadside of a Royal Navy ship of the late 18th century could be fired 2-3 times in approximately 5 minutes, depending on the training of the crew, a well trained one being essential to the simple yet detailed process of preparing to fire. Ironically, the British Admiralty did not see fit to provide additional powder to captains to train their crews, generally only allowing 1/3 of the powder loaded onto the ship to be fired in the first six months of a typical voyage, barring hostile action. Instead of live fire practice, most captains exercised their crews by "running" the guns in and out — performing all the steps associated with firing but for the actual discharge. Some wealthy captains — those who had made money capturing prizes or from wealthy families - were known to purchase powder with their own funds to enable their crews to fire real discharges at real targets.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A fuel cell is an electrochemical energy conversion device. It produces electricity from various external quantities of fuel (on the anode side) and an oxidant (on the cathode side). These react in the presence of an electrolyte. Generally, the reactants flow in and reaction products flow out while the electrolyte remains in the cell. Fuel cells can operate virtually continuously as long as the necessary flows are maintained. [PARAGRAPH:2]Fuel cells are different from batteries in that they consume reactant, which must be replenished, whereas batteries store electrical energy chemically in a closed system. Additionally, while the electrodes within a battery react and change as a battery is charged or discharged, a fuel cell's electrodes are catalytic and relatively stable. Many combinations of fuel and oxidant are possible. A hydrogen cell uses hydrogen as fuel and oxygen as oxidant. Other fuels include hydrocarbons and alcohols. Other oxidants include air, chlorine and chlorine dioxide.[PARAGRAPH:2]The principle of the fuel cell was discovered by German scientist Christian Friedrich Schönbein in 1838 and published in the January 1839 edition of the "Philosophical Magazine". Based on this work, the first fuel cell was developed by Welsh scientist Sir William Robert Grove in 1843. The fuel cell he made used similar materials to today's phosphoric-acid fuel cell. In 1955, W. Thomas Grubb, a chemist working for the General Electric Company (GE), further modified the original fuel cell design by using a sulphonated polystyrene ion-exchange membrane as the electrolyte. Three years later another GE chemist, Leonard Niedrach, devised a way of depositing platinum onto the membrane, which served as catalyst for the necessary hydrogen oxidation and oxygen reduction reactions. This became known as the 'Grubb-Niedrach fuel cell'. GE went on to develop this technology with NASA and McDonnell Aircraft, leading to its use during Project Gemini. This was the first commercial use of a fuel cell. It wasn't until 1959 that British engineer Francis Thomas Bacon successfully developed a 5 kW stationary fuel cell. In 1959, a team led by Harry Ihrig built a 15 kW fuel cell tractor for Allis-Chalmers which was demonstrated across the US at state fairs. This system used potassium hydroxide as the electrolyte and compressed hydrogen and oxygen as the reactants. Later in 1959, Bacon and his colleagues demonstrated a practical five-kilowatt unit capable of powering a welding machine. In the 1960s, Pratt and Whitney licensed Bacon's U.S. patents for use in the U.S. space program to supply electricity and drinking water (hydrogen and oxygen being readily available from the spacecraft tanks).

TEXT.English: [TAB]At the end of World War II, competing Russian, British, and US military and scientific crews raced to capture technology and trained personnel from the German rocket program. Russia and Britain had some success, but the United States benefited the most. The US captured a large number of German rocket scientists (many of whom were members of the Nazi Party, including von Braun) and brought them to the United States as part of Operation Overcast. In America, the same rockets that were designed to rain down on Britain were used instead by scientists as research vehicles for developing the new technology further. The V-2 evolved into the American Redstone rocket, used in the early space program. [PARAGRAPH:2]After the war, rockets were used to study high-altitude conditions, by radio telemetry of temperature and pressure of the atmosphere, detection of cosmic rays, and further research; notably for the Bell X-1 to break the sound barrier. This continued in the US under von Braun and the others, who were destined to become part of the US scientific complex. [PARAGRAPH:2]Independently, in the Soviet Union's space program research continued under the leadership of the chief designer Sergei Korolev. With the help of German technicians, the V-2 was duplicated and improved as the R-1, R-2 and R-5 missiles. German designs were abandoned in the late 1940s, and the foreign workers were sent home. A new series of engines built by Glushko and based on inventions of Aleksei Mihailovich Isaev formed the basis of the first ICBM, the R-7. The R-7 launched the first satellite- Sputnik 1, and later Yuri Gagarin-the first man into space, and the first lunar and planetary probes. This rocket is still in use today. These prestigious events attracted the attention of top politicians, along with additional funds for further research. [PARAGRAPH:2]Rockets became extremely important militarily as modern intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs) when it was realized that nuclear weapons carried on a rocket vehicle were essentially not defensible against once launched, and ICBM/Launch vehicles such as the R-7, Atlas and Titan became the delivery platform of choice for these weapons.

[PARAGRAPH:2]After the war, rockets were used to study high-altitude conditions, by radio telemetry of temperature and pressure of the atmosphere, detection of cosmic rays, and further research; notably for the Bell X-1 to break the sound barrier. This continued in the US under von Braun and the others, who were destined to become part of the US scientific complex. [PARAGRAPH:2]Independently, in the Soviet Union's space program research continued under the leadership of the chief designer Sergei Korolev. With the help of German technicians, the V-2 was duplicated and improved as the R-1, R-2 and R-5 missiles. German designs were abandoned in the late 1940s, and the foreign workers were sent home. A new series of engines built by Glushko and based on inventions of Aleksei Mihailovich Isaev formed the basis of the first ICBM, the R-7. The R-7 launched the first satellite- Sputnik 1, and later Yuri Gagarin-the first man into space, and the first lunar and planetary probes. This rocket is still in use today. These prestigious events attracted the attention of top politicians, along with additional funds for further research. [PARAGRAPH:2]Rockets became extremely important militarily as modern intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs) when it was realized that nuclear weapons carried on a rocket vehicle were essentially not defensible against once launched, and ICBM/Launch vehicles such as the R-7, Atlas and Titan became the delivery platform of choice for these weapons.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Battlefield medicine, also called field surgery and more recently combat casualty care, is the treatment of wounded soldiers in or near an area of combat. Civilian medicine has been greatly advanced by procedures that were first developed to treat the wounds inflicted during combat. With the advent of advanced procedures and medical technology, even polytrauma can be survivable in modern wars. Battlefield medicine is a category of military medicine.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An orbital spaceflight (or orbital flight) is a spaceflight in which a spacecraft is placed on a trajectory where it could remain in space for at least one orbit. To do this around the Earth, it must be on a free trajectory which has an altitude at perigee (altitude at closest approach) above 100 kilometers (62 mi) (this is, by at least one convention, the boundary of space). To remain in orbit at this altitude requires an orbital speed of ~7.8 km/s. Orbital speed is slower for higher orbits, but attaining them requires higher delta-v.[PARAGRAPH:2]The expression "orbital spaceflight" is mostly used to distinguish from sub-orbital spaceflights, which are flights where apogee of a spacecraft reaches space but perigee is too low.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Generally speaking, siege warfare is a form of constant, low intensity conflict characterized by one party holding a strong, static defensive position. Consequently, an opportunity for negotiation between combatants is not uncommon, as proximity and fluctuating advantage can encourage diplomacy. A siege occurs when an attacker encounters a city or fortress that cannot be easily taken by a coup de main and refuses to surrender. Sieges involve surrounding the target and blocking the reinforcement or escape of troops or provision of supplies typically coupled with attempts to reduce the fortifications by means of siege engines, artillery bombardment, mining (also known as sapping), or the use of deception or treachery to bypass defenses. Failing a military outcome, sieges can often be decided by starvation, thirst or disease, which can afflict either the attacker or defender. [PARAGRAPH:2]Sieges probably predate the development of cities as large population centers. Ancient cities in the Middle East show archaeological evidence of having had fortified city walls. During the Warring States era of ancient China, there is both textual and archaeological evidence of prolonged sieges and siege machinery used against the defenders of city walls. Siege machinery was also a tradition of the ancient Greco-Roman world. During the Renaissance and the Early Modern period, siege warfare dominated the conduct of war in Europe. Leonardo da Vinci gained as much of his renown from the design of fortifications as from his artwork. [PARAGRAPH:2]Medieval campaigns were generally designed around a succession of sieges. In the Napoleonic era, increasing use of ever more powerful cannon reduced the value of fortifications. In modern times, trenches replaced walls, and bunkers replaced castles. In the 20th century, the significance of the classical siege declined. With the advent of mobile warfare, a single fortified stronghold is no longer as decisive as it once was. While traditional sieges do still occur, they are not as common as they once were due to changes in modes of battle, principally the ease by which huge volumes of destructive power can be directed onto a static target. Modern sieges are more commonly the result of smaller hostage, militant, or extreme resisting-arrest situations such as the Waco Siege.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Groping for an explanation of the world around them, the earliest humans developed the first concepts of religion. Gradually, rites of worship grew to include sacrifices, ceremonies, vigils, symbology, sacred items, and prayer. One significant step in the advance of worship was the ceremonial burial, often a ritual preparation of the deceased's body for the afterlife his or her culture anticipated. The remains of ceremonial burials offer some of the most detailed information about past civilizations.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Fermentation in food processing typically refers to the conversion of sugar to alcohol using yeast, bacteria, or a combination thereof, under anaerobic conditions. A more general definition of fermentation is the chemical conversion of carbohydrates into alcohols or acids.[PARAGRAPH:2]Human beings are known to have made fermented foods since Neolithic times. The earliest types were beer, wine, and leavened bread (made primarily by yeasts) and cheeses (made by bacteria and molds). These were soon followed by East Asian fermented foods, yogurt and other fermented milk products, pickles, sauerkraut, vinegar (soured wine), butter, and a host of traditional alcoholic beverages. More recently molds have been used in industrial fermentation to make vitamins B-2 (riboflavin) and B-12, textured protein products (from Fusarium and Rhizopus in Europe) antibiotics (such as penicillin), citric acid, and gluconic acid. Bacteria are now used to make the amino acids lysine and glutamic acid. Single-celled protein foods such as nutritional yeast and microalgae (spirulina, chlorella) are also made in modern industrial fermentations.[PARAGRAPH:2]For early societies, the transformation of basic food materials into fermented foods was a mystery and a miracle, for they had no idea what caused the usually sudden, dramatic, and welcomed transformation. Some societies attributed this to divine intervention; the Egyptians praised Osiris for the brewing of beer and the Greeks established Bacchus as the god of wine. Likewise, at many early Japanese miso and shoyu breweries, a small shrine occupied a central place and was bowed to daily.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Mounted archery was a defining characteristic of Steppe warfare throughout Central Asia, and throughout the prairies of America after the adoption of the horse, used by peoples including the Scythians, Sarmatians, Parthians, Huns, Bulgars, Magyars, Mongols, Turks, Comanches, and others. It was also adopted by other peoples and armies, notably Chinese and Romans who both suffered serious conflict with peoples practicing horse archery. It developed separately among the peoples of the South American pampas and the North American prairies; the Comanches were especially skilled. Horse archery was also particularly honoured in the samurai tradition of Japan, where mounted archery is called Yabusame. In some places, such as in Germany and Portugal, the crossbow was favoured over composite bow. Horse archery was never widely used south of the Sahara in Africa, where the ecosystem was less suitable for domestic horses. This was presumably due to factors such as the tsetse fly and lack of suitable fodder. Though some African kingdoms south of the Sahara used horses, they were less useful and had a high mortality rate in these regions. [PARAGRAPH:2]The natives of large grassland areas developed mounted archery for hunting, and for war. The buffalo hunts of the North American prairies may have been the most spectacular and best-recorded examples of bowhunting by mounted archers. Since using a bow requires a horseman to let go of the reins with both hands, horse archers need superb equestrian skills if they are to shoot on the move. It is thought that the Ancient Greeks invented the mythical Centaurs as the perfect union of an archer and a fast moving horseman. [PARAGRAPH:2]In battle, horsed archers were typically skirmishers; lightly-armed missile troops capable of moving swiftly to avoid close combat or to deliver a rapid blow to the flanks or rear of the foe. In the tactic of the Parthian shot the horseman would retreat from the enemy while turning his upper body and shooting backwards. Due to the superior speed of mounted archers, troops under attack from horse archers were unable to respond to the threat if they did not have ranged weapons of their own. Constant harassment would result in casualties, morale drop and disruption of the formation. Any attempts to charge the archers would also slow the entire army down.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Mounted archery was a defining characteristic of Steppe warfare throughout Central Asia, and throughout the prairies of America after the adoption of the horse, used by peoples including the Scythians, Sarmatians, Parthians, Huns, Bulgars, Magyars, Mongols, Turks, Comanches, and others. It was also adopted by other peoples and armies, notably Chinese and Romans who both suffered serious conflict with peoples practicing horse archery. It developed separately among the peoples of the South American pampas and the North American prairies; the Comanches were especially skilled. Horse archery was also particularly honoured in the samurai tradition of Japan, where mounted archery is called Yabusame. In some places, such as in Germany and Portugal, the crossbow was favoured over composite bow. Horse archery was never widely used south of the Sahara in Africa, where the ecosystem was less suitable for domestic horses. This was presumably due to factors such as the tsetse fly and lack of suitable fodder. Though some African kingdoms south of the Sahara used horses, they were less useful and had a high mortality rate in these regions. TEXT.English: [TAB]Maps provide a diagrammatic representation of an area, showing terrain features, cities, and other landmarks. The earliest maps were etched clay tablets charting Babylonian lands for the purposes of taxation. Around the same time, the Chinese produced regional maps drawn on silk cloth. In between 600 and 200 BC, the Greeks produced several maps of the known world, including the first map showing a primitive system of latitude and longitude. Traders and merchants primarily used these early maps. Seamen, who often set their courses based only on the tales brought back by previous voyagers, benefited most from the science of map making.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Castes are systems of occupation, endogamy, social culture, social class, and political power, the assignment of individuals to places in the social hierarchy is determined by social group and cultural heritage. Although India is often now associated with the word "caste", it was first used by the Portuguese to describe inherited class status in their own European society.[PARAGRAPH:2]In medieval Europe, the estates of the realm were a caste system. The population was divided into nobility, clergy, and the commoners. In some regions, the commoners were divided into burghers, peasants or serfs, and the estateless. Although originally based on occupation, one's estate was eventually inherited, because of low social mobility. Poland's nobility were more numerous than those of all other European countries, forming some 8% of the total population in 1791, and almost 16% among ethnic Poles. By contrast, the nobilities of other European countries, except for Spain and Hungary, amounted to a mere 1-3%. In France, serfdom lasted legally until 1789. It persisted in Austria-Hungary till 1848 and was abolished in Russia only in 1861.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Indian caste system describes the social stratification and social restrictions in the Indian subcontinent, in which social classes are defined by thousands of endogamous hereditary groups, often termed as jātis or castes. Within a jāti, there exist exogamous groups known as gotras, the lineage or clan of an individual, although in a handful of sub-castes like Shakadvipi, endogamy within a gotra is permitted and alternative mechanisms of restricting endogamy are used (e.g. banning endogamy within a surname). The fluidity of the caste system was affected by the arrival of the British. Prior to that, the relative ranking of castes differed from one place to another. The castes did not constitute a rigid description of the occupation or the social status of a group. Since the British society was divided by class, the British attempted to equate the Indian caste system to the class system. They saw caste as an indicator of occupation, social standing, and intellectual ability. During the initial days of the British East India Company's rule, caste privileges and customs were encouraged, but the British law courts disagreed with the discrimination against the lower castes. However, British policies of divide and rule as well as enumeration of the population into rigid categories during the 10 year census contributed towards the hardening of caste identities.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A vassal in the terminology that both preceded and accompanied the feudalism of medieval Europe, is one who enters into mutual obligations with a monarch, usually of military support and mutual protection, in exchange for certain guarantees, which came to include the terrain held as a fief. By analogy it is applied to similar systems in other feudal societies. It was always distinct from fidelitas, sworn loyalty of subject to king, and the honor, the respect and consideration that accrued to the vassal, unlike the delegated power of a comes or count, was not expressed in expectations of related public duty.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Aristocracy is a form of government, in which a select few such as the most wise, strong or contributing citizens rule, often starting as a system of co-option where a council of prominent citizens add leading soldiers, merchants, land owners, priests, or lawyers to their number. Aristocracy deforms when it becomes hereditary elite. Aristocracies have most often been deformed to hereditary plutocratic systems. They sometimes include a monarch who although a member of the aristocracy, rules over it as well as over the rest of society.[PARAGRAPH:2]The term "aristocracy" is derived from the Greek language aristokratia, meaning 'the rule of the best'. The term "aristocracy" was first given in Athens to young citizens (the men of the ruling class) who led armies from the front line. Because military bravery was highly regarded as a virtue in ancient Greece, it was assumed that the armies were being led by "the best". From the ancient Greeks, the term passed on to the European Middle Ages for a similar hereditary class of military leaders often referred to as the "nobility". As in ancient Greece, this was a slave-holding class of privileged men whose military role allowed them to present themselves as the most "noble", or "best".

TEXT.English: [TAB]Crop rotation is the practice of growing a series of dissimilar types of crops in the same area in sequential seasons for various benefits such as to avoid the build up of pathogens and pests that often occurs when one species is continuously cropped. Crop rotation also seeks to balance the fertility demands of various crops to avoid excessive depletion of soil nutrients. A traditional component of crop rotation is the replenishment of nitrogen through the use of green manure in sequence with cereals and other crops. It is one component of polyculture. Crop rotation can also improve soil structure and fertility by alternating deep-rooted and shallow-rooted plants.

Crop rotation also seeks to balance the fertility demands of various crops to avoid excessive depletion of soil nutrients. TEXT.English: [TAB]The office of the pope is called the Papacy, and his ecclesiastical jurisdiction the "Holy See" or "Apostolic See". The pope is also head of state of Vatican City, a sovereign city-state entirely enclaved by the city of Rome. [PARAGRAPH:2]Early popes helped to spread Christianity and resolve doctrinal disputes. After the conversion of the rulers of the Roman Empire (the conversion of the populace was already advanced even before the Edict of Milan, 313), the Roman emperors became the popes' secular allies until, with the loss of the emperors' power in the west, Pope Stephen II was forced in the 8th century to appeal to the Franks for help, beginning a period of close interaction with the rulers of the west. For centuries, the forged Donation of Constantine also provided the basis for the papacy's claim of political supremacy over the entire former Western Roman Empire. In medieval times, popes played powerful roles in Western Europe, often struggling with monarchs for power over wide-ranging affairs of church and state, crowning emperors (Charlemagne was the first emperor crowned by a pope) and regulating disputes among secular rulers.

TEXT.English: [TAB]During the Ancient period and the Middle Ages in Europe armoured cavalry referred to any horse-mounted troops that used chain mail or plate armour for protection, and often added this to their mount's furniture also. Between the late 17th and mid-19th centuries armoured cavalry referred to those cavalry regiments that retained the cuirass, and were commonly known as cuirassiers. At a later date they we sometimes called heavy cavalry which referred to their large horses and not the weight of the cuirass.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The history of anatomy as a science extends from the earliest examinations of sacrificial victims to the sophisticated analyses of the body performed by modern scientists. It has been characterized, over time, by a continually developing understanding of the functions of organs and structures in the body. The field of Human Anatomy has a prestigious history, and is considered to be the most prominent of the biological sciences of the 19th and early 20th centuries. Methods have also improved dramatically, advancing from examination of animals through dissection of cadavers to technologically complex techniques developed in the 20th century.[PARAGRAPH:2]Anatomy teaching is one of the cornerstones of a doctor’s medical education. Despite being a persistent portion of teaching from at least the renaissance, the format and the amount of information being taught has evolved and changed along with the demands of the profession. What is being taught today may differ in content significantly from the past but the methods used to teach this have not really changed that much. For example all the famous public dissections of the middle ages and early renaissance were in fact prosections. Prosection is the direction in which many current medical schools are heading in order to aid the teaching of anatomy and some argue that dissection is better. However looking at results of post graduate exams, medical schools (specifically Birmingham) that use prosection as opposed to dissection do very well in these examinations. This would suggest that prosection can fit very well into the structure of modern medical training.
